description.narrative: To ensure effective, inclusive, accountable and participatory local governance in Turkey, through support to further implementation of the local administration reform process undertaken between 2003-2013, in line with international standards.

activity-description.narrative: Base of operation is Ankara. Target groups are mainly 30 Metropolitan municipalities

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).

description.narrative: * Compliance of Turkish Local Administration system with principles and standards set by the European Charter of Local Self-governments, other European conventions and the recommendations of the Council of Europe. * Number of municipalities in which the new model of local administration is implemented;Level of satisfaction of local administration services users in municipalities benefiting from the assistance. * a)# recommendation reports on legislative changes for effective local service delivery prepared. UNDP started to work on the Inception Phase activities, visiting and/or holding meetings with partners and stakeholders, ensuring cooperation and consultation with them to have a common understanding on the project objective, activities and workplan and to ensure their ownership, analysis of the findings from the Inception Phase activities and consultations, production of the Inception Report, start planning of the specific activities in consultation with relevant stakeholders, exploration of the best practice cases from EU member states, establishment of pool of experts, etc. Beneficiaries and UNDP also reiterated their commitment and ownership for the Project and made clear in the steering committee meetings and Launch event that they will spend every effort and to take further measures to alleviate the risk of reoccurrence of such circumstances in the future. Such efforts are also clearly described in the report. As a consequence of such initiatives, project activities promisingly accelerated, and mobilization of further activities were put on the project pipeline. By virtue of strengthened project administration and resulting with more effective logistical support, TAT enabled the swift organization of expert mobilizations, of number of fact-finding studies, workshops, field visits. Such endeavours started to bear their fruits now with envisaged outputs as detailed in the relevant parts of report. In addition, Technical study visits were effectively organized, and one study visit was already completed and others on the way. Recently, launch event was successfully organized and completed.
